profileText: A Senator from South Dakota; born in Ticonic, Monona County, Iowa, May 10, 1877; attended the public schools at Sioux City, Iowa; graduated from Beloit (Wis.) College in 1899; moved to Yankton, Yankton County, S.Dak., in 1901 and engaged in banking; member, State house of representatives 1911-1912; member, State senate 1913-1916; lieutenant governor of South Dakota 1917-1920, Governor 1921-1924; elected as a Republican to the United States Senate and served from March 4, 1925, to March 3, 1931; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1930; moved to Dixon, Ill., in 1933 and engaged in banking until his death there on September 14, 1968; interment in Oakwood Cemetery.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Pressler, Larry. "William H. McMaster.'' In U.S. Senators from the Prairie, pp. 90-96. Vermillion, SD: Dakota Press, 1982.
Tingley, Ralph R. "The Crowded Field: Eight Men for the Senate.'' South Dakota History 9 (Fall 1979): 316-36.

researchRecord.name: March 1925. 1 letter. To Jay N. Darling concerning Darling's illness.
1921-1925. 1 box. Gubernatorial papers. Also 2 folders of correspondence (1901-1925) in the W. W. Armstrong and Doane Robinson papers.
